column4: shouldnt apt-get install linux-source-2.6.24 gimme the latest 2.6.24, or at least the one i have installed? i just apt-get install linux-source-2.6.24 and im on 2.6.24-19 but it gave me sources for 2.6.24-3 :||||
3 is lower than 19
thats what im talking about :|||
and what are your deb-src lines?
i dunno exactly how you mean it, but every line i got is of this style deb-src http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ hardy-security main restricted and they are all uncommented :p
I want to know all your deb-src lines. I say what I mean
you are most likely lacking such a line for security updates
i suppose a paste of the sources.list would then suffice :||
http://pastebin.com/f669880d7
http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/linux-image-2.6.24-19-generic asd you can see there, the source exists in the repos
then your packages lists are out of date or there are errors when you update them
delete them all and apt-get update again
apt-cache policy linux-source-2.6.24
pastebin the apt-cache output please
pastebin?
of the apt-cache?
